intro: Cynorkis hetaerioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a compact rosette structure. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
